ðŸš€ alt-sendme | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Direct peer-to-peer file transfer without cloud storage, emphasizing privacy and security.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Send anywhere â€¢ Peer-to-peer direct transfer â€¢ End-to-end encryption â€¢ No accounts or personal info â€¢ Transfer anything
ðŸ“– Summary: Alt-Sendme is a free and open-source file transfer tool that allows users to send files and folders of any size and format directly between devices without storing them on cloud servers. It emphasizes privacy and security through end-to-end encryption and peer-to-peer direct transfers, offering a WeTransfer alternative without accounts or personal information.

ðŸ”¥ rio | Rust
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Providing a fast, modern, and cross-platform terminal emulator experience.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ GPU-accelerated rendering â€¢ Cross-platform support (macOS, Linux, Windows) â€¢ WebAssembly support (in progress) â€¢ Configuration options â€¢ Based on Alacritty's code (ANSI parser, events, processor)
ðŸ“– Summary: Rio is a hardware-accelerated GPU terminal emulator written in Rust, designed to run on desktops (macOS, Linux, Windows) and potentially in web browsers via WebAssembly. It aims to provide a modern terminal experience with performance improvements, leveraging GPU acceleration for rendering.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ tdl | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Downloading files from Telegram, including protected chats, and managing Telegram data through features like message forwarding, file uploading, and data exporting.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Single file start-up â€¢ Low resource usage â€¢ High bandwidth utilization â€¢ Faster than official clients â€¢ Download files from protected chats
ðŸ“– Summary: tdl is a Telegram toolkit written in Go that functions as a Telegram downloader, but with extended capabilities. It offers features like high-speed downloads, low resource usage, and the ability to download from protected chats, forward messages, upload files, and export data to JSON.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ nightingale | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Monitoring and alerting for time-series data, with a focus on flexible alarm distribution and noise reduction.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Alerting engine â€¢ Data source integration (VictoriaMetrics, ElasticSearch) â€¢ Alarm processing and distribution â€¢ Categraf integration for data collection â€¢ Distributed deployment for edge data centers
ðŸ“– Summary: Nightingale is an open-source monitoring and alerting system, designed as an alternative to Grafana for alerting. It focuses on processing and distributing alarms, integrating with existing data sources like VictoriaMetrics and ElasticSearch. It uses Categraf for data collection and supports distributed deployment for edge data centers.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ n8n | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Workflow automation for technical teams, combining no-code and code flexibility.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Code When You Need It (JavaScript/Python, npm packages) â€¢ AI-Native Platform (LangChain integration) â€¢ Full Control (Self-hosting or cloud) â€¢ Enterprise-Ready (Advanced permissions, SSO, air-gapped deployments) â€¢ Active Community (400+ integrations, 900+ templates)
ðŸ“– Summary: n8n is a fair-code workflow automation platform that allows technical teams to build powerful automations with a combination of visual building and custom code. It offers 400+ integrations, native AI capabilities, and options for self-hosting or cloud deployment, providing full control over data and deployments.
